events.name: World War II
events.blurb: A global conflict that reshaped the political and social landscape of the 20th century.

timeline.heading: Germany invades Poland
timeline.text: Germany invades Poland, marking the beginning of World War II.

timeline.heading: Japan attacks Pearl Harbor
timeline.text: Japan attacks Pearl Harbor, drawing the United States into the war.

events.name: French Revolution
events.blurb: A period of radical social and political upheaval in France.
events.description: A period of radical social and political upheaval in France that had a major impact on France and throughout Europe.

timeline.heading: Storming of the Bastille
timeline.text: The storming of the Bastille prison marks the beginning of the French Revolution.

events.name: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
events.blurb: First human mission to land on the Moon, fulfilling Kennedy's ambitious goal.

events.name: JFK Assassination
events.blurb: The shocking assassination of President Kennedy that changed America forever.

events.name: Attack on Pearl Harbor
events.blurb: The surprise attack that brought the United States into World War II.

events.name: March on Washington
events.blurb: The historic march where Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his 'I Have a Dream' speech.

events.name: Sinking of the Titanic
events.blurb: The 'unsinkable' ship's tragic maiden voyage that shocked the world.

events.name: Boston Tea Party
events.blurb: Colonial protest against British taxation that helped spark the American Revolution.

events.name: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.blurb: The closest the world came to nuclear war during the Cold War standoff.

events.name: Wall Street Crash of 1929
events.blurb: Black Tuesday marked the beginning of the Great Depression.

events.name: Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima
events.blurb: The first use of nuclear weapons in warfare that changed history forever.

events.name: Watergate Scandal
events.blurb: The political scandal that led to President Nixon's resignation.
